User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (compatible; MSIE 9.0; Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; Trident/5.0; SLCC2; .NET CLR 2.0.50727; .NET CLR 3.5.30729; .NET CLR 3.0.30729; Media Center PC 6.0; .NET4.0C)

Steps to reproduce:

I have setup my e-mail account as IMAP. While I'm travelling, I sometimes have bad or no internet connection. I open some e-mails more than one time and want to save the attachements to my harddisk.


Actual results:

When I open an email the second/third/... time, Thunderbird starts to load the attachements again from the IMAP server. Once I was successful to open the e-mail, I want to save the attachements to my harddisk. Then Thunderbird again starts to download the attachements from the server. So attachements are not stored persistent yet.


Expected results:

Best case would be: There is an option I can switch on for certain folders (e.g. inbox), to save attachements persistent. So once I have opened an e-mail the first time and Thunderbird downloaded attachements successfully, they are kept on my local computer. So when I open the same e-mail the second/third/... time or save the attachement to my local harddisk, Thunderbird does not start to download it from IMAP again, but uses the local copy. This speeds up work a lot when you are travelling a lot, and have not perfect internet connection all the time!
